links.title: Elon Musk makes a libertarian argument for carbon tax
links.description: Tesla founder and CEO: 'Fossil fuels are already getting a massive subsidy if you believe in global warming.' Tesla Motors founder and CEO Elon Musk made a libertarian argument in favor of a carbon tax during a recent visit to Nevada.

messages.body: $TSLA Daimler's "Drive Pilot" on E-Class has been tested and labeled a joke compared to TSLA's Autopilot http://so.thedrive.com/OJ9NNq3

links.title: The War For Autonomous Driving: 2017 Mercedes-Benz E-Class VS. 2017 Tesla Model S
links.description: It's a DrivePilot vs. AutoPilot cage match fight to the death-potentially yours. Looking for a comparison of the 2017 Mercedes-Benz E-Class and the 2016 Tesla Model S? This is not that. Both are brilliant, gorgeous cars- best-of-breed luxury sedans in the war between internal combustion and electricity-but who cares?

messages.body: $TSLA Elon Musk's push for autopilot unnerves some Tesla employees http://flip.it/Ij-Ui

links.title: Elon Musk's push for autopilot unnerves some Tesla employees
links.description: Those building autopilot were acutely aware that any shortcoming or unforeseen flaw could lead to injury or death -- whether it be blind spots with the car's sensors or drivers misusing the technology. But Tesla founder and CEO Elon Musk believes that autopilot has the potential to save lives by reducing human error -- and has pushed hard to get the feature to market.

links.description: Apple Inc to open 22,000-square-foot office across from BlackBerry's QNX in Ottawa suburb, sources say Vito Pilieci, Postmedia NewsThursday, Jan. 28, 2016 Apple is on a quest to build its own automobile. Its Project Titan has reportedly hired staff from Tesla Motors, Texas Instruments, Volkswagen, Ford Motor Co. and Fiat Chrysler.

links.title: Tesla Gigafactory tour roundup and tidbits: 'This is the coolest factory in the world'
links.description: Yesterday was quite a day in Reno. While we weren't able to fire off our livestream as we'd hoped, we were able to gather a ton of information on the "Coolest Factory in the world" I'll break down the new info, videos and imagery below: Reno and the trip to the Gigafactory: Reno is a small-ish gambling town in the valley near Lake Tahoe with the Truckee river running through it.
